    • Method Detail

      • getInput

        public static java.lang.String getInput()
        Gets the next data that is input into stdin.
        Returns:
        A string of the input into stdin.

      • getInput

        public static java.lang.String getInput(java.lang.String prompt)
        Calls getInput() but prints out the prompt to stdout before requesting input from stdin.
        Parameters:
        prompt - The message to be output to stdout.
        Returns:
        A string of the input into stdin.

      • getInt

        public static int getInt()
        Gets the next data input into stdin and checks if it is an int. If input was not an int it will request input again.
        Returns:
        An int that is > 0 that the user inputted into stdin.

      • getInt

        public static int getInt(java.lang.String prompt)
        Calls getInput() but prints out the prompt to stdout before requesting input from stdin.
        Parameters:
        prompt - The message to be output to stdout.
        Returns:
        An int that is > 0 that the user inputted into stdin.

      • getDate

        public static java.util.Date getDate()
        Gets a date from stdin in the format dd/MM/yyyy. If the input provided is not in that format or is not a valid date then the method will request input again until a valid date is provided. This method will not accept input of dates that are in the past.
        Returns:
        A date object that has been converted from a string the user inputted into stdin.

      • getDate

        public static java.util.Date getDate(java.lang.String prompt)
        Calls getInput() but prints out the prompt to stdout before requesting input from stdin.
        Parameters:
        prompt - The message to be output to stdout.
        Returns:
        A date object that has been converted from a string the user inputted into stdin.

      • waitForEnter

        public static void waitForEnter(java.lang.String prompt)
        Prints out the message provided into stdout and then halts execution until the user presses the enter key.
        Parameters:
        prompt - The message to be output to stdout.
